title: Win two places on an open data course at the ODI

details.excerpt: We’ve all heard of data, and most of us understand what it is and why it’s important. But what about ‘open’ data? Open data is data that anyone can access, use and share. It helps us to share information and knowledge more easily, and it’s changing the way we do business, progress medical research, understand our environment and much, much more.
details.content:
We’ve all heard of data, and most of us understand what it is and why it’s important. But what about ‘open’ data? Open data is data that anyone can access, use and share. It helps us to share information and knowledge more easily, and it’s changing the way we do business, progress medical research, understand our environment and much, much more.

Our prize draw gives you the opportunity to discover, for free, more about how open data can benefit you and your organisation. The winner will receive two free places on our beginner’s course Open Data in a Day.

This fun, interactive and jargon-free one-day course is worth £269 and is run by our in-house open data experts. Whether you have some knowledge of open data, work in a related field or are completely new to it, the course will give you a 360-degree view of the open data landscape, the social, economic and environmental benefits it can bring, and boost your confidence in working with it.

Terms and conditions apply. The deadline for entry is 12pm on 12 March 2016.

Enter now


Terms and conditions

  • The draw will close on 12 March 2016 at 12pm.
  • One winner will be selected at random.
  • The winner can choose any Open Data in a Day course occurrence at the ODI during 2016 – the next course is 11 April 2016.
  • This prize cannot be exchanged for cash or other services offered by the ODI.

related.title: What is ‘open data’ and why should we care?
Open Data in a Day, 11 April 2016
